A Layout_macro_component is a type of . A Layout_macro_component uses a as the usage definition for the shape of the unexpanded macro in the design. The design definition is the contents of the macro to be expanded. A Layout_macro_component may be exchanged as part of a recursive layout definition. A Layout_macro_component itself generates no Stratum_features since it is not expanded. A Layout_macro_component does inherit terminals from the . These terminals are used in the floor planning layout process. These terminals may be on any layer necessary in the design.
The recursive definition must end on a Definition_based_layout_occurrence that is not a Layout_macro_component.
the design_definition specifies the role of a for the Layout_macro_component.

A Layout_macro_definition_terminal_to_usage_terminal_assignment is the association between the and one of several fabricated features. The purpose for this assignment is to link the product data in the macro definition to the floor planning usage view to support a recursive definition. The Layout_macro_definition_terminal_to_usage_terminal_assignment shall be referenced by one .
In a recursive definition, both a macro definition and the macro interface declaration that is the are archived together, with this relationship populated as necessary to provide linkages between the fabricated features in the macro definition and the features in the planning view. Without this linkage populated, there is no way to traverse the recursive definition so as to successfully resolve the terminals at each level of recursion.
This facility is used to support transport of CAD data where geometric subroutines that include layer data and terminal data are defined.

A Layout_macro_floor_plan_template is a type of . A Layout_macro_floor_plan_template is part of a recursive definition or a geometric subroutine. A Layout_macro_floor_plan_template provides a layout shape and a set of terminal definitions for floor planning and layout purposes. The application compiler will replace the layout shape provided by this application object with the detailed definition specified by the Layout_macro_definition referenced by the macro_definition attribute.
An occurrence of this object is a that is instantiated during floor planning layout during the design process for the interconnect substrate.
The shape of the Layout_macro_floor_plan_template should encompass the shape of the macro definition.

the macro_definition is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Layout_macro_floor_plan_template is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Layout_macro_floor_plan_template as a floor_layout_view. There shall be zero or one Layout_macro_definition for a Layout_macro_floor_plan_template.

A Layout_macro_definition is a type of . A Layout_macro_definition is a design view of a interconnect structure that is intended to be reused as a structure rather than as a component. A Layout_macro_definition may be an aggregation of . A Layout_macro_definition may be an aggregation of A Layout_macro_definition shall not be used as a component in a physical assembly.
A Layout_macro_definition may be used as part of a recursive definition or subroutine layout.

the floor_layout_view specifies the for the Layout_macro_definition as a layout template for the floor planning layout. This template shall provide the terminal definitions for the Layout_macro_definition and a shape for the floor planning layout to enable the layout design without instantiating the design details of the Layout_macro_definition itself.
The floor_layout_view is a replacement for the usage_view that would be inherited from the .
